result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kenzy L Small

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Kenzy L Small in court.  Attorney Connor Romenesko in court for Kenzy L Small.  Attorney Patrick O'Keefe in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE. Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests a status date.  Court set date as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.
Status conference scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Crivello.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Shelton, Br. 40.

Defendant Kenzy L Small in court with Attorney Connor Romenesko.  Arthur Kenneth Thexton appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR IN PERSON.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer W. Mauch. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Scheduling conference scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on August 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Time of next court date changed from 1:30pm as stated on the record to 8:30am due to witness availability. Parties notified.

Defendant Kenzy L Small in court in person.  Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for preliminary hearing. States witness is present. OPD needs additional time to appoint an attorney. State requests that this matter be set in the trial court for a State V. Lee hearing; denied.  Court finds good CAUSE to adjourn preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 1 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.
  No possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription.
  No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Kenzy L Small in court with attorney Dawn Marie Rablin.  Defendant Kenzy L Small in custody.  Alexander James Geocaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
